arm_group.description: Healthy volunteer (HV)group to receive selumetinib 50mg (2x25mg) orally
End stage renal disease (ESRD)patients to recieve selumetinib 50mg (2x25mg) orally
If deemed necessary patients with mild and/or moderate and/or severe renal impairment will recieve selumetinib 50mg(2x25mg) orally

brief_summary.textblock:
A study to assess the pharmacokinetics, safety and tolerability of Selumetinib (AZD6244,
      ARRY-142886) in subjects with renal impairment and healthy subjects

clinical_study.brief_title: To Assess the Pharmacokinetics, Safety and Tolerability of Selumetinib in Renal Impaired Subjects and Healthy Subjects

detailed_description.textblock:
An open label study to assess the pharmacokinetics, safety and tolerability of 50 mg single
      oral dose of Selumetinib (AZD6244, ARRY-142886) in subjects with renal impairment and
      healthy subjects

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria all participants:

          1. Male and female (non childbearing potential) subjects aged 18 years or more with
             suitable veins for cannulation or repeated venipuncture.

          2. Have a weight of at least 50 kg (110 lbs) and body mass index (BMI) between 18 and 40
             kg/m2, inclusive.

             Inclusion healthy volunteers only:

          3. Must be in good health as determined by a medical history, physical examination, 12
             lead ECG, clinical laboratory evaluations, and an ophthalmic examination performed
             before the administration of the investigational product.

             Inclusion renal impaired patients only:

          4. Stable renal function

        Exclusion Criteria all participants:

          1. Subjects of Japanese or non Japanese Asian ethnicity.

          2. Any one parent or grandparent (maternal or paternal) is Japanese or non-Japanese
             Asian (e.g. China, Taiwan, Korea, Philippines, Thailand, Vietnam and Malaysia).
             Asian Indians are acceptable.

          3. Subjects who smoke more than 10 cigarettes or the equivalent in tobacco per day

          4. In the opinion of the investigator, any evidence of additional severe or uncontrolled
             systemic disease (eg, currently unstable or uncompensated hepatic, cardiovascular, or
             respiratory disease) or laboratory finding, physical examination, hematology,
             clinical chemistry, urinalysis, vital signs, or 12-lead ECG that makes it undesirable
             for the subject to participate in the study.

             Exclusion renal impaired patients only:

          5. Subjects with an active renal transplant (subjects who have previously received a
             renal transplant and are currently undergoing dialysis due to transplant failure may
             be enrolled).

          6. Acute coronary syndrome within 6 months prior to administration of the
             investigational product.

intervention.description: selumetinib 50 mg (2x25mg) administered by mouth as capsules

clinical_study.keyword: Phase I, healthy, pharmacokinetics, renal impairment
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label Comparative Study of the Pharmacokinetics, Safety and Tolerability of Selumetinib (AZD6244, ARRY 142886) (Hyd Sulfate) Following a Single Oral Dose in Subjects With Renal Impairment and Healthy Subjects

overall_contact.last_name: Quintiles Drug Research Unit Call Centre

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: This will be taken at visit 2 for Healthy volunteers and at visit 2 and 3 for patients with end stage renal disease
primary_outcome.measure: Description of the pharmacokinetic(PK) profile in terms of maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax)

primary_outcome.description: This will be taken at visit 2 for Healthy volunteers and at visit 2 and 3 for patients with end stage renal disease
primary_outcome.measure: Description of PK profile in terms of area under plasma concentration-time curve from zero extrapolated to infinity (AUC)

primary_outcome.description: This will be taken at visit 2 for Healthy volunteers and at visit 2 and 3 for patients with end stage renal disease
primary_outcome.measure: Description of PK profile in terms of area under plasma concentration-time curve to time of last measurable concentration (AUC[0-t]) for selumetinib if AUC is not reportable in more than 80% of subjects

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of the safety profile in terms of adverse events, physical examinations, ophthalmologic assessments, vital signs, clinical laboratory assessments and 12-lead electrocardiograms.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until follow up. Approximately 6 weeks for healthy volunteers and 8 weeks for renal patients

secondary_outcome.description: This will be taken at visit 2 for Healthy volunteers and at visit 2 and 3 for patients with end stage renal disease
secondary_outcome.measure: Description of the PK profile in terms of time to reach maximum observed concentration administration (tmax)

secondary_outcome.description: This will be taken at visit 2 for Healthy volunteers and at visit 2 and 3 for patients with end stage renal disease
secondary_outcome.measure: Description of PK profile in terms of area under the plasma concentration time curve from zero to 12 hours postdose (AUC[0-12])

secondary_outcome.description: This will be taken at visit 2 for Healthy volunteers and at visit 2 and 3 for patients with end stage renal disease
secondary_outcome.measure: Description of PK profile in terms of terminal rate constant (λz), terminal elimination half-life (t1/2), apparent oral clearance (CL/F)

secondary_outcome.description: This will be taken at visit 2 for Healthy volunteers and at visit 2 and 3 for patients with end stage renal disease
secondary_outcome.measure: Description of PK profile in terms of apparent volume of distribution at steady state (Vss/F) and apparent volume of distribution during the terminal phase (Vz/F)

secondary_outcome.description: This will be taken at visit 2 for Healthy volunteers and at visit 2 and 3 for patients with end stage renal disease
secondary_outcome.measure: Description of PK profile in terms of mean residence time (MRT) and fraction unbound (fu), free Cmax (Cmax, u), free AUC (AUCu), free AUC(0-t) (AUC[0-t],u) and unbound CL/F (CL/Fu)

secondary_outcome.description: These collection will be taken on visit 2 for the healthy volunteers and on visit 2 and 3 if the patients can produce urine
secondary_outcome.measure: Description of PK profile in terms of the amount of drug excreted in urine (Ae) the fraction of dose excreted in urine (fe), renal clearance (CLR) for selumetinib and AUC, Cmax, tmax, t1/2, λz, AUC(0-12) and AUC(0-t)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The urine collection intervals will be from -12 to 0 (predose), and 0 to 6, 6 to 12, 12 to 24, 24 to 36, 36 to

secondary_outcome.description: These samples will be taken on visit 2 for the healthy volunteers and on both visit 2 and visit 3
secondary_outcome.measure: Description of the PK profile in terms of the metabolite to parent AUC and Cmax ratios (MRAUC and MRCmax)
Description of the PK profile in terms of Ae, fe, and CLR for N-desmethyl selumetinib (and the amide metabolite, if deemed appropriate)

secondary_outcome.description: This will only be taken at the visit when dose is given 1h before dialyse start
secondary_outcome.measure: Description of the PK profile in terms of time-matched area under the plasma concentration time curve from 1 to 5 hours postdose (AUC[1-5])
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Sample taken predose, at 1h just before dialyse and at 5h after the end of the dialyse

secondary_outcome.description: This will only be collected during visit 2 and only on end stage renal disease patients
secondary_outcome.measure: Description of the PK profile in terms of cumulative amount extracted during dialysis (Ad[1-5]), and dialysis clearance (CLD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples taken from  dialysate collections over 1 hour intervals throughout the entire (approximately 4 hours) dialysis period ie, 0 to 1, 1 to 2, 2 to 3, 3

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
